body: @lkxiaolou Merged. Thanks for providing this.

I tested by setting the `plugin.mysql.trace_sql_parameters=true` in the config file and run locally:

if "isRunningInAsyncMode" is false, "asyncFinishLock" doesn't do anything. why not create it when "isRunningInAsyncMode" is true @wu-sheng

We could. But could you provide benchmark of creating Counter and Lock by using jmh in multiple threads case. I am willing to see the result. 

If you have positive result, send a pull request for this change with benchmark and result. Cc @kezhenxu94
I know with less operations, should have better performance, I just want to know how much improvement.
I know what you are worried about. Please let me have a try @wu-sheng

Hi @wu-sheng here I've rewrote the instrumentations for the sake of performance, at least it behaviors as if it doesn't exist when `trace_sql_parameters=false`

Thanks for kindly reminding me the concerns of performance and the suggestions.
Grant shell to execute right, run commit the shell

I will review the detail later, look like positive. Let's discuss on a pull request. 
@Arugal send one, please.

I will dive on this later. I don't think we should use synchronized and reentrancelock should not have npe.
Could you explain how npe happens? Have you try atomicref or volatile.
maybe I need to take a closer look at the prepareForAsync usage scenario
Yes. From my understanding, your proposal basically is safe.

@Arugal As `asyncSpanCounter` and `asyncFinishLock` are used in multiple threads, and they are lazy-initialized. You need `volatile`, otherwise, when the main thread creates it, the other threads may still use the old value(void), which causing NPE.
@dmsolr Thanks for providing this valuable scripts in CI. @ascrutae I am merging this CI scripts, which could very helpful for our further plugin review.
CI fail because of new changes.
I know that. However, I am not familiar with the usage scenario of ```async``` for fear of unexpected results.

`async` is easy. `awaitFinishAsync` in tracing context thread if you need to span to close in another thread(`span#prepareForAsync`), then `TracingContext#asyncStop`(`span#asyncFinish`) called in another thread.
So ```asyncStop``` and ```asyncFinish``` are always invoker after ```awaitFinishAsync```, and there is no concurrency problem with ```awaitFinishAsync```

> So asyncStop and asyncFinish are always invoker after awaitFinishAsync, and there is no concurrency problem with awaitFinishAsync

In theory yes, but even there is concurrency situation for `awaitFinishAsync`, what is the matter?

Hi,
I am interesting with this enhancement because i am working on the AMP service for our application, and it build up with internal framework which had zipkin reporter native code. Tell me if there are something i can help, and which is helping myself.
@Duncan-tree-zhou I have list them in this issue. We could discuss more details if you have some questions.
I am not sure redis is a good one to do register center. There are plenty of them already, I think the user could easily implement their own. Could you just ignore this?
OK
I will try it.

@wu-sheng here are my questions:
1. how many ways we can solve this problem.
  - for my understanding, to compose and transform zipkin traces into skywalking segments is the way with least modification.
  - are there any other way to implement the enhancement?
2. if we chose a way, how many functionalities we should implement to complete the integration.
  - let's say to transform the zipkin format to segments. We should implement a transformer. Is it enough to make work? 
3. what is the prolems and primary concerns ( in different dimension and details) to implement the functionalities?
  - let's say to implement the transformer. how may attrs zipkin format has and how may attrs sykwalking format has. how to map the attrs. Maybe we can draw a table to the maping and find out like which attrs are required but zipkin format not provided etc.

> for my understanding, to compose and transform zipkin traces into skywalking segments is the way with least modification.

We could save Zipkin trace by using span based, rather than segment of SkyWalking. I have implemented it, which is much friendly to Zipkin. Read this, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/backend/backend-storage.md#elasticsearch-6-with-zipkin-trace-extension

The reason I proposed this, is Zipkin trace can't transfer to SkyWalking segments perfectly. That is why we put in the document, analysis is not production ready.

> are there any other way to implement the enhancement?

The most important enhancement are analysis metrics from zipkin span. This means, match zipkin client-server span and generated SkyWalking scopes(Service, ServiceRelation, etc.), like `SourceBuilder` used by `MultiScopesSpanListener`.

> let's say to transform the zipkin format to segments. We should implement a transformer. Is it enough to make work?

This may be not necessary.

> what is the prolems and primary concerns ( in different dimension and details) to implement the functionalities?

I think mostly is in OAP cluster mode. Zipkin spans of a trace could be sent to the different instances in an uncertain time, so, we need to make client/server match perfectly.  Such as using Redis Cluster to be central cache?(Maybe only)
do you solve the problemÔºü
Haha, you are going to implement all possible implementations I listed there. :P

> The most important enhancement are analysis metrics from zipkin span. This means, match zipkin client-server span and generated SkyWalking scopes(Service, ServiceRelation, etc.), like SourceBuilder used by MultiScopesSpanListener.

for my understanding, zipkin reporter did not collect metrics information(since zipkin did not support to collect metrics data).  if you have no hand you can't make a fist. so i think maybe you can recomend users to use a metrics agent to collection the metrics data?

> I think mostly is in OAP cluster mode. Zipkin spans of a trace could be sent to the different instances in an uncertain time, so, we need to make client/server match perfectly. Such as using Redis Cluster to be central cache?(Maybe only)

I am not understanding that if SW had save the zipkin spans in db(like es). why a central cache is needed? why the storage can't be the data central?

> > Could you please run the tests with the original test code and agent code of this PR? I'll run the modified version locally and post the result here
> 
> Our tests will use these PR codes, not original codes. @kezhenxu94

@wu-sheng What I meant is to ask @IanCao to use the original **test codes** to test these PR codes (with the config key off, which is by default), and in order to test the codes with the config key on, I have to modify some **test codes**, and I'll use the modified test codes to test these PR code, make sense?

And I am trying to implement the SW agents for components of our framework . They remake many wheels like the Driver/rpc/webdispatcher etc. It looks like that to implement agents is the easier way to work out. The Skywalking agent SDK is really very good.

> for my understanding, zipkin reporter did not collect metrics information(since zipkin did not support to collect metrics data). if you have no hand you can't make a fist. so i think maybe you can recomend users to use a metrics agent to collection the metrics data?

I mean analysis metrics from traces, like we did from SkyWalking traces. We just don't have JVM.

> I am not understanding that if SW had save the zipkin spans in db(like es). why a central cache is needed? why the storage can't be the data central?

Same as above, I was talking about `analysis metrics from Zipkin trace`.

> And I am trying to implement the SW agents for components of our framework . They remake many wheels like the Driver/rpc/webdispatcher etc. It looks like that to implement agents is the easier way to work out. The Skywalking agent SDK is really very good.

In most cases, I think agent plugin should be much better, and have better performance.

@kezhenxu94 @zhaoyuguang @IanCao We are trying to move agent test into our CI with some refactor. Review has not begun, but welcome to take part in. We will need a lot of contributions from here.

@kezhenxu94 e2e test should be located in `test/e2e`

> I mean analysis metrics from traces, like we did from SkyWalking traces. We just don't have JVM.

Are there any articles or docs to discrip how Skywalking analysis the metrics of traces in cluster mode?

> Are there any articles or docs to discrip how Skywalking analysis the metrics of traces in cluster mode?

No, I am afraid. But in the short version, SkyWalking has special header and segment formats, very different with Zipkin span based. It is designed particularly for APM, rather than tracing. 
I think you can't learn from those about how to analysis Zipkin span. `MultiScopesSpanListener` to `SourceBuilder` is still the best refer. You need to analysis spans, and get all Scopes of SkyWalking, and send them OAL engine. This feature requires clear understanding of what is SkyWalking OAP and OAL scripts.

> Check style module is being removed, right?

Yes, the module is just used for holding the `checkstyle.xml` file, and the file can be simply placed in the directory. After removing it, changing the checkstyle.xml doesn't require a deployment of that module.

> And do I still need that scripts to check? Could we remove that?
